meanings.definition: To place or fit between two things
meanings.sent1: She was sandwiching the cheese between the bread slices for her lunch.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter was sandwiching the new shelf between the two existing ones.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was sandwiching the acorn between its paws before burying it.
meanings.sent4: The artist was sandwiching layers of paint to create a textured effect on the canvas.
meanings.sent5: The hiker was sandwiching her map between two rocks to keep it from blowing away.

meanings.sent1: He was sandwiching his opinion into the conversation about the new project.
meanings.sent2: The detective was sandwiching the key evidence into the case file.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat was sandwiching itself between the dog and the couch.
meanings.sent4: The comedian was sandwiching jokes between the serious topics in his routine.
meanings.sent5: The teacher was sandwiching fun activities into the lesson plan to keep the students engaged.

meanings.definition: To layer or stack between two surfaces
meanings.sent1: The baker was sandwiching the cream between the cake layers to make a delicious dessert.
meanings.sent2: She was sandwiching the photos between the pages of her scrapbook.
meanings.sent3: The gardener was sandwiching the flower bulbs between the soil for planting.
meanings.sent4: The architect was sandwiching the glass panels between the steel beams for the modern design.
meanings.sent5: The tailor was sandwiching the fabric layers to create a quilt for the winter.
